159.question: What is typical GAN architecture for each text-to-image synhesis group?
159.response: {'Answer': 'Typical GAN architectures for text-to-image synthesis can be categorized based on the enhancement they provide: Semantic Enhancement GANs focus on improving the relevance between the text and the generated images; Resolution Enhancement GANs aim at increasing the resolution and clarity of the generated images; Diversity Enhancement GANs seek to enhance the variety in the generated images; and Motion Enhancement GANs introduce motion and temporal dynamics into the synthesis process. Common approaches include using multiple discriminators or generators, hierarchical approaches with nested discriminators, and multi-stage generation processes, as well as implementing conditioning on text data to guide the image synthesis. These
159.answer:
Semantic Enhancement GANs: DC-GANs, MC-GAN
Resolution Enhancement GANs: StackGANs, AttnGAN, HDGAN
Diversity Enhancement GANs: AC-GAN, TAC-GAN etc.
Motion Enhancement GAGs: T2S, T2V, StoryGAN
